title: Terminal Accessible service
description:
Travelator (a moving walkway) and lift linking can be used to navigate inside the terminals of the airport
Wheelchair can be rented upon request with prior notification. Contact your airline directly to organise a wheelchair for you
Parking for people with disabilities on each terminal and can be found adjacent to the lift near exit door
Accessible toilet at terminals 3 and 4r
Priority seating spaces are available in all terminals at both departure level and ground floor

title: Disable Parking
description:
Waiting zones for people with motor impairment are in front of T1, T2 and T3 (Note: driver must remain with vehicle at all times)
Assistant who holds companion card are eligible for full parking fee refund if they can prove that the passenger was either departing or arriving on a flight while parking for not more than 2 hours. Refund request can be lodged online https://www.melbourneairport.com.au/Passengers/FAQ#p_lt_ctl00_zoneContent_pageplaceholder_p_lt_ctl00_zoneFlexible_MA_SimpleTextControl1_pnlBodyCopy

title: Security Screening
description:
Notify the security staff of prosthesis prior to passing through the walk-through metal detector so alternate screening can be conducted
Identify the location of medical implant to the security staff (If physical search is required, then traveller can request to have the physical search conducted in private)
Contact their airline in relation to the carriage of medical equipment through the screening points and on board their flight.
list: Wheelchairs and walking aids are required to be screened at security point and passengers are advised to:

title: Assistance
description:
Melbourne Airport’s Integrated Operation Centre (+61 3 9297 1901), and speak with a Landside Operations Control Room Operator
Direct assistance from airline when booking your ticket, contact details https://www.melbourneairport.com.au/airline-information
list: To request for wheelchair assistance, contact:

title: Access to/from aircraft
description:
Request assistance from airline staff for boarding and disembarking
Notify the relevant airline or agent at the time of booking with confirmation prior to travel to allow appropriate assistance to be provided at the time of boarding or disembarking from the aircraft
Request the airline at the time of booking to access the boarding lounge lifts
Where aerobridges are not available, equipment is available for lifting travellers on and off an aircraft and airline staff will assist travellers in boarding or disembarking from the aircraft when there is no aerobridge available
list: Travellers requiring assistance are advised to:

title: wheelchair specific
description:
Arrive early for boarding
Transfer to an airline wheelchair for boarding and disembarking
Advising their airline and ground crew how best they can be assisted. (Note:Airline wheelchairs are narrow in width to facilitate movement up and down the aircraft aisles.)
The traveller’s wheelchair will be tagged and cleared for stowage in the baggage hold
The carriage of battery-powered wheelchairs and mobility aids by airlines is regulated under national and international laws, and cannot travel as baggage within the baggage hold
Carry details of the type of battery installed within their mobility aid and notify the airline when making arrangements.
